detaileddescription.para: The queue, actually storing the processes waiting for the condition to become true
Check all the entities in the queue?
Indicates the method where something has gone wrong. Is passed as a parameter to the method checkProcess().
Counter for the SimProcesses which are refused to be enqueued, because the queue capacity is full.

memberdef.argsstring: (desmoj.core.simulator.Model owner, String name, int sortOrder, int qCapacity, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: CondQueue

detaileddescription.para: Constructor for a CondQueue where entities can wait for a certain condition (to become true). The queueing discipline and the capacity limit of the underlying queue can be chosen. Highest priority are always first in the queue.

parameterdescription.para: Model : The model this CondQueue is associated to.
int : determines the sort order of the underlying queue implementation. Choose a constant from QueueBased like QueueBased.FIFO or QueueBased.LIFO or ...
int : The capacity of the queue, that is how many processes can be enqueued. Zero (0) means unlimited capacity.
boolean : Flag, if CondQueue should produce a report or not.
boolean : Flag for trace to produce trace messages.

memberdef.argsstring: (desmoj.core.simulator.Model owner, String name, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: CondQueue

detaileddescription.para: Constructor for a CondQueue where entities can wait for a certain condition (to become true). The underlying queue has a Fifo queueing discipline and unlimited capacity.

parameterdescription.para: Model : The model this CondQueue is associated to.
boolean : Flag, if CondQueue should produce a report or not.
boolean : Flag for trace to produce trace messages.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a Reporter to produce a report about this CondQueue.

simplesect.para: desmoj.report.Reporter : The Reporter for the queue inside this CondQueue.

detaileddescription.para: Returns if all entities or only the first one in the queue are getting a signal to check their conditions.

simplesect.para: boolean : Are all entities in the queue checking their conditions? Default is false, so that only the first process in the queue is checking its condition.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the implemented queueing discipline of the underlying queue as a String, so it can be displayed in the report.

simplesect.para: String : The String indicating the queueing discipline.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of entities refused to be enqueued in the queue, because the capacity limit is reached.

simplesect.para: long : The number of entities refused to be enqueued in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the flag checkAll: if all entities or only the first one in the queue are getting a signal to check their conditions.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : Flag if all entities in the queue should check their conditions? Default is false, so that only the first entity in the queue is checking its condition.

detaileddescription.para: A signal () should be sent every time when a condition has changed and might be true now. It activates the first process in the queue to check its condition again. Other processes might follow.
Returns the first process waiting in the queue. If there is no process waiting, null is returned.

simplesect.para: SimProcess : Returns the first process in the queue (or null if no process is waiting).

detaileddescription.para: Returns the first process waiting in the queue that complies to the given condition. If there is no such process waiting, null is returned.

simplesect.para: SimProcess : Returns the first process in the queue which complies to the given condition.

parameterdescription.para: Condition : The Condition cond is describing the condition to which the process must comply to. This has to be implemented by the user in the class: Condition in the method: check().

detaileddescription.para: Removes the given SimProcess from the Queue. The process no longer waits for its condition to become true and resumes its lifecycle.

parameterdescription.para: P : The P to be removed from the queue

detaileddescription.para: Lets the current process wait in the CondQueue until a certain condition, given as a parameter, has become true. When the process finds its condition to have become true or checkAll is set to true the next process in the queue will be activated, too. If the capacity limit of the queue is reached, the process will not be enqueued and false returned.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the process can be enqueued successfully, false otherwise (i.e. capacity limit of the queue is reached).

parameterdescription.para: Condition : The condition that has to become true before the process can continue.

detaileddescription.para: Activates the given SimProcess and schedules him right after the current process. Then the process is responsible to check if the desired condition has become true. This is done in the method waitUntil().

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : The process that will be activated now to check its condition.

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the entity using the CondQueue is a valid process.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns whether the SimProcess is valid or not.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : Is this SimProcess a valid one?

detaileddescription.para: In a CondQueue processes are waiting for a specific condition to become true. Process synchronisation happens when processes are waiting in a queue for a specific condition to become true. Each process which uses waitUntil(condition) and does not find this condition to be true, is inserted in a waiting-queue automatically. Whenever something happens which might influence the condition to become true, signal() should be used to check if the first entity (or, if the attribute checkAll is set to true, all entities) in the waiting-queue finds the desired condition now and therefore can continue. The designer of the model is responsible that this check takes place! He also has to implement the condition, this can easily be done by deriving it from the interface Condition. The flag, if only the first or all entities in the queue are checking their conditions again, can be checked and changed using getCheckAll() and setCheckAll(). The first sort criteria of the queue is always highest priorities first, the second queueing discipline of the underlying queue and the capacity limit can be determined by the user (default is FIFO and unlimited capacity). CondQueue is derived from QueueBased, which provides all the statistical functionality for a queue.

QueueBased
